poem:
A Quiet Declaration  

In the hushed corridors of power,  
she speaks, a whisper against the roar,  
where hearts are measured in ballots.  
Her words unfold like old maps,  
revealing truths long buried,  
a fresh light on aged stones—  
a choice not hers alone,  
but echoes through the silent hills,  
a right to shape one's own dawn.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
